author: Cashcleaner
title: Excellent addition to my Lego Fire Department
review: I picked this kit up for less than $20 (CAN) and I believe it's worth every penny.  While I will admit that some parts have been "juniorized" such as the rotor elements and bottom landing rails, it's not a huge issue for me, and I think detracts only marginally from the overall design.  The water cannons at the sides are a great feature, as are the two side storage compartments and accessories.  It's a beautiful kit with a great price for it.

author: mrmitch
title: LEGO rocks with the new City sets!
review: Any LEGO City set made from 2005 to date (2007) is well thought out and are simply awesome. The Fire Helicopter is no exception. It goes well with the entire fire set and is a must for any town or city collector. Little touches like the water cannons on the side of the copter are cool. Great affordable set - protect your town from fire get this copter today.

author: Zapp_Brannigan
title: Good, Could be better
review: This set goes great with any fire station. First of all, it comes with a phone, axe, binoculars, water cannons, fire extinguisher and fire fighter. The only problem is that the water cannons fall off too easily, and once the cockpit is closed, it still leaves a gap which exposes the cabin to the exterior. Overall neat set and reasonable price.

author: TheAviator12
title: Where it all began...
review:
For my first review on Brickset, I saw it fit to review the set where it all began, my first-ever LEGO set, the Fire Helicopter.

This set was pretty simple, basically a cockpit, accessory storage, a rotor, and skids. The side water tanks were cool. A little flimsy, but otherwise pretty well done. The pilot was nothing extraordinary, just your average LEGO firefighter. 

I don't recall much of my playing with this set, as I was 7 years younger than I am now, but I remember  liking how the whole thing looked quite realistic, except for the space between the windscreen and the rest if the fuselage. 

The price was extremely reasonable. $10 adjusted for inflation and LEGO's recent price hikes (boo, hiss) would result in a set like this costing about $17 USD. I was gifted 2 of this set (not both at the same time) and built both. 

Overall, not a bad set. The cons are few and far between, and the price was definitely one of the set's strong points. I would recommend this set to anybody who collects old sets or who wants to build their firefighting force.


Thanks for reading!
